## âœ… Issue Resolved

I've completed the analysis and implemented a fix for the extra quotes issue in release notes.

### ğŸ” Root Cause Found

When the workflow_dispatch manual trigger passes the description `Test patch release (instant)`, the `command-stream` library adds shell escaping by wrapping it in single quotes. This resulted in:

```bash
# Input: "Test patch release (instant)"
# Command executed: node scripts/instant-version-bump.mjs --description "'Test patch release (instant)'"
# Value received: "'Test patch release (instant)'"
```

The quotes then became part of the actual value in CHANGELOG.md and propagated to the GitHub release.

### ğŸ› ï¸ Solution Implemented

Implemented a three-layer defense-in-depth approach:

1. **Primary Fix**: Pass description via environment variable instead of command-line argument (avoids shell escaping entirely)
2. **Defensive Fallback**: Add quote stripping in instant-version-bump.mjs
3. **Cleanup Layer**: Improve regex in format-release-notes.mjs to handle escaped quotes

### ğŸ“š Comprehensive Case Study Created

As requested, I've created a detailed case study at `docs/case-studies/issue-129/` with:

- Complete timeline of events with evidence from CI logs
- Deep root cause analysis 
- Multiple solution proposals with pros/cons
- References to GitHub community discussions on escaping issues
- All CI logs and release data preserved

### ğŸ§ª Testing

Created experiment scripts to validate the quote stripping logic across various edge cases. All tests pass âœ…

See PR #130 for the complete implementation: https://github.com/link-foundation/test-anywhere/pull/130

The PR is now ready for review!
